com.linecorp.armeria.common.stream

Interface StreamMessage<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element signaled
    All Superinterfaces:
    org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HttpRequest, HttpResponse
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHttpRequest, DefaultHttpResponse, DefaultStreamMessage, DeferredHttpResponse, DeferredStreamMessage, FilteredHttpResponse, FilteredStreamMessage, PublisherBasedStreamMessage, StreamMessageWrapper

    public interface StreamMessage<T>
extends org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T>
    A variant of Reactive Streams Publisher, which allows only one Subscriber. Unlike a usual Publisher, a StreamMessage can stream itself only once. It has the following additional operations on top of what the Reactive Streams API provides:
    • isOpen()
    • isEmpty()
    • closeFuture()
    • abort()

    When is a StreamMessage open?

    A StreamMessage is open since its instantiation until:

    • the Subscriber consumes all elements and Subscriber.onComplete() is invoked,
    • an error occurred and Subscriber.onError(Throwable) is invoked,
    • the Subscription has been cancelled or
    • abort() has been requested.

    Getting notified when a StreamMessage is closed

    Subscriber.onComplete() and Subscriber.onError(Throwable) will not be invoked when its Subscription has been cancelled or aborted. Use closeFuture() if you need to get notified when a StreamMessage is closed regardless of whether it's been cancelled, aborted or closed.

    Publication and Consumption of ReferenceCounted objects

    StreamMessage will reject the publication request of a ReferenceCounted object except ByteBuf and ByteBufHolder.

    StreamMessage will discard the publication request of a ByteBuf or a ByteBufHolder silently and release it automatically when the publication is attempted after the stream is closed.

    For ByteBuf and ByteBufHolder, StreamMessage will convert them into their respective unpooled versions that never leak, so that the Subscriber does not need to worry about leaks.

    If a Subscriber does not want a StreamMessage to make a copy of a ByteBufHolder, use subscribe(Subscriber, boolean) or subscribe(Subscriber, Executor, boolean) and specify true for withPooledObjects. Note that the Subscriber is responsible for releasing the objects given with Subscriber.onNext(Object).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort()
      Cancels the Subscription if any and closes this publisher.
      CompletableFuture<Void> closeFuture()
      Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when this publisher is complete, either successfully or exceptionally.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this stream has been closed and did not publish any elements.
      boolean isOpen()
      Returns true if this publisher is not closed yet.
      void subscribe(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<? super T> s)
      Requests to start streaming data to the specified Subscriber.

      Requests to start streaming data, invoking the specified Subscriber from the specified Executor.

    • Method Detail

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Returns true if this publisher is not closed yet.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this stream has been closed and did not publish any elements. Note that this method will not return true when the stream is open even if it has not published anything so far, because it may publish something later.

      • closeFuture

        CompletableFuture<Void> closeFuture()
        Returns a CompletableFuture that completes when this publisher is complete, either successfully or exceptionally.

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<? super T> s)
        Requests to start streaming data to the specified Subscriber.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface org.reactivestreams.Publisher<T>
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is a Subscriber who subscribed to this stream already

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<? super T> s,
               boolean withPooledObjects)
        Requests to start streaming data to the specified Subscriber.
        Parameters:
        withPooledObjects - if true, receives the pooled ByteBuf and ByteBufHolder as is, without making a copy. If you don't know what this means, use subscribe(Subscriber).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is a Subscriber who subscribed to this stream already

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<? super T> s,
               Executor executor)
        Requests to start streaming data, invoking the specified Subscriber from the specified Executor.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is a Subscriber who subscribed to this stream already

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(org.reactivestreams.Subscriber<? super T> s,
               Executor executor,
               boolean withPooledObjects)
        Requests to start streaming data, invoking the specified Subscriber from the specified Executor.
        Parameters:
        withPooledObjects - if true, receives the pooled ByteBuf and ByteBufHolder as is, without making a copy. If you don't know what this means, use subscribe(Subscriber).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is a Subscriber who subscribed to this stream already

      • abort

        void abort()
        Cancels the Subscription if any and closes this publisher.
